page.title: 11THE NATIONAL TRUST
page.content: The National Trust at Middle Hope has been designated a Special Site of Scientific Interest; as the National Trust state in their forthcoming information sheet on the area 'both for its fascinating geological composition and its wealth of natural history and grasses'. The keen ornithologist can spend hours on the peninsula and nearby area observing the many different and often quite rare birds who frequent and even nest in the area. For those more interested in plantlife the headland is a hive of interest. An exploration of the salt marsh yields many finds. Millions of years of geological history are there to be seen by the keen and knowledgeable studies of rock formations.
